title: How to Clear Recently Closed Tabs on Google Chrome

steps.title: Click the menu at the top-right corner of Chrome ⋮.
steps.content: Click the menu at the top-right corner of Chrome ⋮ . It's the icon with three dots in the upper-right corner. This displays the More menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Hover your mouse over the History option.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over the History option. It's in the More menu. This displays your recently closed tabs. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . It's at the top of the History menu. This opens your entire browser history in a new tab. [3] X Research source Alternatively, you can press Ctrl + H on PC or Command + H on Mac to open your History.

steps.title: Click Clear browsing data.
steps.content: Click Clear browsing data . It's at the bottom of the menu to the left. This displays options for clearing your browser data. [4] X Research source Alternatively, if you want to clear a specific item in your recently closed data, click the icon with three dots next to that item and click Remove from History .

steps.title: Ensure "Browsing history" is checked.
steps.content: Ensure "Browsing history" is checked. It's at the top of the menu in the pop-up window. This should be checked automatically, but check to make sure.

steps.title: Select a time frame.
steps.content: Select a time frame. Use the drop-down menu at the top of the page to select a time frame. To clear your recently closed data, select "Last Hour" or "Last 24 Hours." If you need more time, you can select "Last 7 days," "Last 4 weeks," or "All Time." [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear data.
steps.content: Click Clear data . It's the blue button in the lower-right corner of the pop-up window. This will clear all your browser history from within the time frame you selected. It will also clear your "Recently Closed" data. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open Google Chrome .
steps.content: Open Google Chrome . It has an icon that resembles a red, green, yellow, and blue wheel. Tap the Google Chrome icon on your Home screen or Apps menu.

steps.title: Tap Click ⋮ or ⋯.
steps.content: Tap Click ⋮ or ⋯ . It's the icon with three dots in the upper-right corner. This displays the More menu. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . It's in the More menu. It has an icon that resembles a clock with an arrow pointing backward. This displays your recent browsing history. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear Browsing Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Browsing Data . On Android, it's at the top of your browsing history. On iPhone and iPad, it's at the bottom. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Ensure "Browsing history" is checked.
steps.content: Ensure "Browsing history" is checked. It's at the top of the menu in the pop-up window. This should be checked automatically, but check to make sure.

steps.title: Select a time frame.
steps.content: Select a time frame. Use the drop-down menu at the top of the page to select a time frame. To clear your recently closed data, you can select "Last Hour" or "Last 24" hours. If you need more time, you can select "Last 7 days", "Last 4 weeks," or "All Time."

steps.title: Tap Clear Data or Clear Browsing Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Data or Clear Browsing Data . It's at the bottom of the menu. On Android, it's the blue button in the lower-right corner. On iPhone and iPad, it's the red text at the bottom of the screen. This clears your recent browsing data as well as your recently closed data. [10] X Research source
